pr_title: Fix default metadata sync executor sizes

timeline.message: Fix default metadata sync executor sizes

timeline.bodyText: This default is different than what you used before. Is it intentional?
timeline.author: ggezer
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2142,15 +2142,19 @@ public String toString() {
           .build();
   public static final PropertyKey MASTER_METADATA_SYNC_EXECUTOR_POOL_SIZE =
       new Builder(Name.MASTER_METADATA_SYNC_EXECUTOR_POOL_SIZE)
-          .setDefaultValue(32)
+          .setDefaultSupplier(() -> Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors(),
+              "The total number of threads which can concurrently execute metadata sync "
+                  + "operations.")
           .setDescription("The number of threads used to execute all metadata sync"
               + "operations")
           .setScope(Scope.MASTER)
           .setConsistencyCheckLevel(ConsistencyCheckLevel.WARN)
           .build();
   public static final PropertyKey MASTER_METADATA_SYNC_UFS_PREFETCH_POOL_SIZE =
       new Builder(Name.MASTER_METADATA_SYNC_UFS_PREFETCH_POOL_SIZE)
-          .setDefaultValue(32)
+          .setDefaultSupplier(() -> Math.max(1, Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors() / 2),

timeline.bodyText: Can you change the value of PropertyKey.Name.MASTER_METADATA_SYNC_UFS_PREFETCH_POOL_SIZE to meet the prop name. It currently ends with parallelism.
timeline.author: ggezer

timeline.bodyText: What does this do? (and what is the behavior with and without this change?)
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: If no metadata syncs are occurring the executor will spin down threads to decrease resource utilization
replies.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: The impact is that the first time a sync needs to occur when there have been no syncs within the last minute there will be a slight overhead for that RPC to create the threads. The overhead is equivalent to the time to create the threads needed to process the sync.
replies.author: ZacBlanco
